b2e7a259dc58.title: Internet is bombarded with articles on this subject.

paragraphs.text: Internet is bombarded with articles on this subject. This is probably the best I’ve read so far. Thank you for writing it! A lot of these we learnt growing up and many resonate…esp. the boundaries and pleasing. I really liked number 6., so true about American culture. Number 8. — stay in that calm place regardless of what — is my ultimate goal.
paragraphs.name: f9ec

paragraphs.text: Remarkable piece,thank you for sharing
paragraphs.name: 36d0

paragraphs.text: Amazing article!

content.subtitle: #1, 2 and 5 are important to me. I am in the beginning stages of planning my business and I think I haven’t been doing as much as I should…

virtuals.subtitle: #1, 2 and 5 are important to me. I am in the beginning stages of planning my business and I think I haven’t been doing as much as I should…

paragraphs.text: This is an excellent article.
paragraphs.name: d520

paragraphs.text: #1, 2 and 5 are important to me. I am in the beginning stages of planning my business and I think I haven’t been doing as much as I should because I’m spending too much time trying to plan for perfection. My thought process envisions staying as far away from failures as possible.. And to really…
paragraphs.name: d884

5ea01adcfe56.title: I am largely on my way to stop to try to please all and everyone.

paragraphs.text: I am largely on my way to stop to try to please all and everyone. And it feels gooooood ! Now I need to stop feeling guilty when I am NOT busy (probably because I have my things in order and am allowed to sit down) — I am keeping this article as a small mantra of reminders. Thank you.

7cf3417381b1.title: 8 Mental Habits the Most Successful People Learn to Break

content.subtitle: It’s not what you learn, but what you unlearn that matters.

virtuals.subtitle: It’s not what you learn, but what you unlearn that matters.

paragraphs.text: 8 Mental Habits the Most Successful People Learn to Break
paragraphs.name: e5ec

paragraphs.text: It’s not what you learn, but what you unlearn that matters.

I believe #1 Pleaseing and #2 Boundries. I have found that the people you allow into your life ( romantic and platonic ) effect our ability to achieve our goals. Not having the “strength” to end relationships due to taking other persons ‘feelings” above your own inner voice , hinders many, many accomplishments.
paragraphs.name: 2d7b

819f38cb40e3.title: Jaime, thanks so much for your comment on my article.

paragraphs.text: Jaime, thanks so much for your comment on my article. To-do and to-bo lists or dropping the lists altogether! I am a GOALDIGGER and I beleive firmly in clear intentions and aims. It all needs to come from the right place inside each of us, and ont be directed by outside pressure, nor driven by our own internal pressure to feel a long to-do list makes…
paragraphs.name: 770e

78c90d0da2f8.title: Extreemely insightful and helpful article, thank you!

paragraphs.text: Extreemely insightful and helpful article, thank you!
I would only add:
paragraphs.name: d11a

paragraphs.text: - Stay conscious, open and curious to always keep learning and improving at a natural pace.
paragraphs.name: c40e

paragraphs.text: - Steal and adopt good habits with pride.
paragraphs.name: d067

paragraphs.text: Most importantlyAt least once per year STOP reflect and enjoy

e2655f15f6c6.title: #8 is the single best piece of advice I have seen.

paragraphs.text: #8 is the single best piece of advice I have seen.
paragraphs.name: 7db3

5ef74ab2dc8b.title: I think the “really, really busy” situation is the greatest challenge.

paragraphs.text: I think the “really, really busy” situation is the greatest challenge. Somehow the importance of leaders and other employees in some organizations is equated with demand for one’s time-and if you aren’t operating at a flat-out run, some higher level bosses will find ways to get you there, not understanding the harm they cause in the process.
paragraphs.name: a87a

a58c6b397d51.title: For me unlearning “getting really, really busy” would make a huge difference for me.

paragraphs.text: For me unlearning “getting really, really busy” would make a huge difference for me. In my world, there are so many things/people that require my attention that it’s hard for me to slow down at times. And when I do, I either feel guilty or in the back of my mind, I know there are still things that I need to do. I’m a mother of 4 children, a wife, and…
Good stuff, thank you.
paragraphs.name: 0f64

paragraphs.text: #2 is my favourite. It’s the thing which has brought most success – not just personally, but to those who have worked with and for me. It allowed us to be more successful together and build a culture which peers have pondered on how to recreate. It also makes creating space to think less daunting because trust in others is implicit to agreeing boundaries.

90f7078ec21d.title: Thanks for sharing! Was really helpfull. For me the ‘busy part’ sounded very familiar.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for sharing! Was really helpfull. For me the ‘busy part’ sounded very familiar.
paragraphs.name: 12af

paragraphs.text: Outstanding article !
paragraphs.name: 636a

paragraphs.text: And number 8—the task list. People generally associate a to do list with success when in truth it is a sheer example of their failures. Aim to accomplish one thing at a time and do it well. I personally aim to do absolutely nothing every day. If I accomplish one task/goal, I have exceeded my expectations. Kill the task list.
paragraphs.name: fcdf

949ba7f1c134.title: I consider that the Balance is the vital principle of life.

content.subtitle: One has to behave in a pleasant manner but he should not become a pushover.

virtuals.subtitle: One has to behave in a pleasant manner but he should not become a pushover.

paragraphs.text: I consider that the Balance is the vital principle of life. In Tamil there is a proverb: அளவுக்கு மீறினால் அமுதமும் நஞ்சாகும். That is, if it exceeds the prescribed limit, even nectar would become poison.
paragraphs.name: ab5a

paragraphs.text: One has to behave in a pleasant manner but he should not become a pushover.
paragraphs.name: 297e

649a815c3ea2.title: A great article Sandja and a definitive read for people obsessed with the ‘what-more-to-add-in-self…

paragraphs.text: A great article Sandja and a definitive read for people obsessed with the ‘what-more-to-add-in-self-to-get’ ahead syndrome. One couldn’t get a clearer picture on why unlearning is essential for unleashing the potential.
paragraphs.name: 7ef2

346e5c7af021.title: AND #9. Wanting to belong to a club, group, religion or organization that turns you into a mere…

paragraphs.text: AND #9. Wanting to belong to a club, group, religion or organization that turns you into a mere member or worse, a number—basically a nobody, should not be a desired goal in life. A famous quote by Graucho Marx at the Friars’s Club of Beverly Hill comes to mind, “I Don’t Want to Belong to Any Club That Will Accept Me as a Member.” In that statement…
paragraphs.name: c352
